titleStmt.title: Using Geospatial Data to Inform Historical Research in R
titleStmt.author: Eric Weinberg

sourceDesc.p: Born digital, in a markdown format. This lesson is original.

abstract.p: In this lesson, you will use R-language to analyze and map geospatial data.

p.note: For a broader discussion on the role of geographic information and GIS in the humanities see Placing History: How Maps, Spatial Data, and GIS Are Changing Historical Scholarship (Esri Press, 2008) and Harris, Trevor M., John Corrigan, and David J. Bodenhamer, The Spatial Humanities: GIS and the Future of Humanities Scholarship (Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 2010).
